text: David John Leonard (born 25 November 1965) is a former New Zealand cricketer who played for the Central Districts Stags. In 1989–90 Leonard took 10 for 133 for the Central Districts Stags against the Northern Districts Knights in Rotorua for his first-class debut. He was born in Timaru. In February 2020, he was named in New Zealand's squad for the Over-50s Cricket World Cup in South Africa. However, the tournament was cancelled during the third round of matches due to the coronavirus pandemic. ==References== ==External links== *CricketArchive Profile Category:1965 births Category:Living people Category:New Zealand cricketers Category:Central Districts cricketers Category:Cricketers from Timaru
title: David Leonard (cricketer)
